title: GPS-deduced ROTI index: standard deviation of rate of change of Total Electron Content (TEC) in a 5 min interval every 15 min; world maps and movies - Xiaoqing Pi (Jet Propulsion Laboratory)

info.x_cadence_note: Counts based on variable 'Epoch' in https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/sp_phys/data/gps/roti15min_jpl/2012/gps_roti15min_jpl_20121129_v01.cdf. The most common cadence occurred for 100.0000% of the 95 timesteps. Cadence = 900000 [ms] = PT15M.

parameters.name: rotimedM
parameters.description: ROTI, world map, cyl proj, median in 2.5 x 5 deg bins, expandable thumbnails. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['rotimed']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.
